intro: Axanthes, commonly known as the goldenroot, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic, yellowish roots that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and prefers well-drained soils. Axanthes has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, white or greenish flowers in umbels. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both medicinal and horticultural purposes.
